qas.question: When did the first HDTV transmissions happen in Europe?
What event was the first HDTV broadcast in Europe?
When did Europe abandon standard transmission?
Where was the FIFA World Cup able to be watched in HDTV?

answers.text: 8 cinemas in Italy and 2 in Spain

qas.question: When did the first SDTV transmissions happen in Europe?
When did Europe not abandon standard transmission?

plausible_answers.text: 8 cinemas in Italy and 2 in Spain

qas.question: Where was the FIFA World Cup able to be watched in SDTV?

context: The first HDTV transmissions in Europe, albeit not direct-to-home, began in <a0_0>1990<a0_0/>, when the Italian broadcaster RAI used the HD-MAC and MUSE HDTV technologies to broadcast the 1990 <a1_0><b4_0>FIFA World Cup<b4_0/><a1_0/>. The matches were shown in <a3_0><b6_0>8 cinemas in Italy and 2 in Spain<b6_0/><a3_0/>. The connection with Spain was made via the Olympus satellite link from Rome to Barcelona and then with a fiber optic connection from Barcelona to Madrid. After some HDTV transmissions in Europe the standard was abandoned in the <a2_0><b5_0>mid-1990s<b5_0/><a2_0/>.
